long_description:
dev_cookbooks_test Cookbook =========================== TODO: Enter the cookbook description here. e.g. This cookbook makes your favorite breakfast sandwhich. Requirements ------------ TODO: List your cookbook requirements. Be sure to include any requirements this cookbook has on platforms, libraries, other cookbooks, packages, operating systems, etc. e.g. #### packages - `toaster` - dev_cookbooks_test needs toaster to brown your bagel. Attributes ---------- TODO: List you cookbook attributes here. e.g. #### dev_cookbooks_test::default
Key Type Description Default
['dev_cookbooks_test']['bacon'] Boolean whether to include bacon true
Usage ----- #### dev_cookbooks_test::default TODO: Write usage instructions for each cookbook. e.g. Just include `dev_cookbooks_test` in your node's `run_list`: ```json { "name":"my_node", "run_list": [ "recipe[dev_cookbooks_test]" ] } ``` Contributing ------------ TODO: (optional) If this is a public cookbook, detail the process for contributing. If this is a private cookbook, remove this section. e.g. 1. Fork the repository on Github 2. Create a named feature branch (like `add_component_x`) 3. Write you change 4. Write tests for your change (if applicable) 5. Run the tests, ensuring they all pass 6. Submit a Pull Request using Github License and Authors ------------------- Authors: TODO: List authors
name: dev_cookbooks_test

recipes.dev_cookbooks_test::rightlink_cli_test_r: Additional recipe-helper to test rightlink cli tool
recipes.dev_cookbooks_test::rightlink_cli_tools_: Test to verify RightLink CLI tools available options. Only for RL 5.9.5+
recipes.dev_cookbooks_test::ssh_key_test_vscale: Test to verify that the sshkey found in /var/spool/cloud/meta-data exists in /root/.ssh/authorizedkeys file

nat_test/nat_routes_expected.description: Set true or false to enable or disable NAT routes. Works only for vScale cloud (Linux and Windows).

ssh_test/ssh_public_key_expected.description: True/False to execute test-case. Works only for Linux OS and vScale cloud.

cli_test/param.description: Do not set manually this field. It should be provided by json file
cli_test/param.display_name: test param to provide it by json file

ohai_plugin_test/expected_network_adapte.description: What network adaptors should we expected to find. choose both for instances with both a public and private adapters -- like one EC2.
